actionchart.helpText: displays a chart showing how many times various bot commands have been used in the guild. Mention a user after the command to see commands for that user (e.g. `actionchart @Code`), or use without a name to see commands for the whole guild.
actionchart.shortHelp: displays a chart showing how many times bot commands have been used.

leaderboard.helpText: shows the levels and XP rankings of all members in the guild (with the exception of bots and members that have 0 XP).
leaderboard.shortHelp: shows the XP rankings for the guild.

nick.helpText: can be used without arguments to generate a random nickname for yourself every 30 minutes. If you want a custom nickname (for a fee), you can specify it after the command (e.g. `nick Awesome Boy`). You can use `nickname reset` to clear any nicknames once the timer is up.

profile.helpText: shows various information about yourself or another user. A user can be mentioned after the command to see their profile information instead of your own (e.g. `profile @Code`).
profile.shortHelp: shows basic profile information about a user.

roles.helpText:
is used to add or remove self-assignable roles. Use without arguments (e.g. `roles`) to see the list of available roles.
Additionally, the following arguments may be used:
__*Add*__ - Used to give yourself a role (e.g. `roles add pink`).
__*Remove*__ - Used to remove a role that you have (e.g. `roles remove pink`).
__*Usernames*__ - Used to see which roles a user has (e.g. `roles @Code`).
roles.shortHelp: views, adds, or removes self-assignable guild roles.

roleadmin.helpText: is used to add or remove roles to either Discord roles or to the list of self-assignable roles. Use without arguments (e.g. `roleadmin`) to see the list of available roles.
roleadmin.shortHelp: views, adds, or removes self-assignable roles to the guild.
